text:
We have a new blog from one of our best; Speech and Language Therapy student Sophie! This one is WELL WORTH a read.

Shortly before the new year, Sophie was involved in an accident which resulted in 4 fractured vertebrae. Despite this, she refuses to let it hold her back! Her latest blog focuses on what to do in the event of the unexpected ü¶∏‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è‚ú®

https://blogs.city.ac.uk/slt2015/2019/01/17/what-happens-when-the-unexpected-happens/

text: With only one month to go until applications for this year‚Äôs Mayor‚Äôs Entrepreneur closes there is no time like the present for you to get your ideas in. Along with the three ¬£20k prize funds and additional training for all applicants we are also offering mentorship opportunities for all finalists and 20 other applicants as well as the chance to receive specialist business support from Advance London. With so much on offer there is no reason for you not to apply!

The Cass Course Office are running user testing sessions on the City, University of London website on either Wednesday 20th, Thursday 21st or Friday 22nd February 2019 (one-hour sessions). text: Last chance to get 50% off your first month membership at CitySport. Offer ends midnight 31st January. Visit www.citysport.org.uk to sign up. *Direct debit memberships only, T&C's apply.

text:
***FENCING NEWS***

Due to the popularity of our first Learn to Fence programme, we will be running another course, starting next week!

Our 10 week programme, is open to all City, University of London students wishing to give the sport a go. 

We anticipate this course filling up fast, therefore places will be offered on a first come, first served basis. The course costs ¬£15 and is available to book now. 

Students will need to register their details on the CitySport website prior to coming in or phoning to book and pay. https://www.citysport.org.uk/ 

*Students will need to commit to the whole programme and cannot join after the course has commenced
